cohortName: Celecoxib referent concept incident cohort: First occurrence of referent concept + descendants with >=365d prior observation
logicDescription: Persons with drug exposure of referent concept (1118084) or descendants, for the first time in the persons history, with at least 365 days of prior continuous observation.  Persons exit cohort at the end of continuous drug exposure.

cohortName: Celecoxib referent concept prevalent cohort: First occurrence of referent concept + descendants
logicDescription: Persons with drug exposure of referent concept (1118084) or descendants, for the first time in the persons history.  Persons exit cohort at the end of continuous drug exposure.
All dispensations of Celecoxib with exit on continuous drug exposure
clinicalRationale: To help understand the periods of continous use of Celecoxib

cohortName: [1118084004] Second dispensation of Celecoxib, till end of drug continuous coverage for second dispensation
logicDescription: Second dispensations of Celecoxib with exit on continuous drug exposure
clinicalRationale: To study if repeat users of celecoxib have a different pattern of continuous use compared to first time users of Celecoxib

cohortName: Users of diclofenac with no history of gastrointestinal hemorrhage
logicDescription: All events of diclofenac exposure, with inclusion criteria of no gastrointestinal hemorrhage at any time in past. Cohort exit at continous exposure of diclofenac with 30 days of persistence window
clinicalRationale: These diclofenac users never had a history of GI hemorrhage

logicDescription: First time new users of Diclofenac who are Male

cohortName: Male Diclofenac with body system disorder
logicDescription: First time new users of Diclofenac who are Male with some body system disorder at any time

cohortName: Users of diclofenac with history of gastrointestinal hemorrhage
logicDescription: All events of diclofenac exposure, with inclusion criteria of gastrointestinal hemorrhage at any time in past. Cohort exit at continous exposure of diclofenac with 30 days of persistence window
clinicalRationale: These diclofenac users had a history of GI hemorrhage
